title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 21 m[arch 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 21 M[arch 1873]
text: 21 March 1873M 21My dear darling waltWalti receevedreceived your letter yesterday likewise the graphics i like them very much i should think they would be a sucsesssuccess i am in hopes walterWalter dear you will soon be well again i am pretty well at any rate i work around full as much as i want to but of course itsit's slow but i dontdon't get much credit for it) but i dontdon't care for that Lou sLou's aunt is staying here at present she appears a clever woman but the best of it we have better grub as a general thing we live pretty saving but i suppose itsit's all right i haventhaven't heard from Jeff in a long time) i wish waltWalt you would send we an envelope directed to Jeff i get letters from hattee the last one she wrote said her father had been to kansasKansas city but had returned (i suppossuppose they get along pretty well in their boarding place but there is no place like your own home i hope when the girls get older so they can take the charge of a house jeffJeff will keep houshouse again i suppose as things was it was the only thing he could doodo) i think waltWalt when folks get old like you and me they ought to have a home of their own but i try to be contented as i might be much worse off i have many little things to put up with but we all have our annoyances some one way and some another) georgeGeorge is good enoughfenough to me but he thinks and its all right he should that every thing Lou does is all right) georgeGeorge aintain't like to get the brooklyBrooklyn work at present and that is a great disappointment georgeGeorge is a good man but i dontdon't think i ever saw any one so changed he used to be so generous and free but now he is very saving never goes out any where) so we go walterWalter dear only try to get well once more) poor dear matt i think of her day and night but i very seldom mention her name waltWalt mattiMatty was a kind daughter to me i have cause to regret her death)good biegive my best Love to mrsMrs. oconorO'Connorwrite as often as you can dear waltWalt Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 21 M[arch 1873]
